definition: A condition in which the body or a region of the body is deprived of adequate oxygen supply
A below-normal level of oxygen in the blood, specifically in the arteries
An abnormally rapid heart rate, usually over 100 beats per minute in adults
A slower than normal heart rate, typically below 60 beats per minute in adults
A condition characterized by an increased number of red blood cells in the bloodstream
Difficult or labored breathing; also referred to as shortness of breath
A hormone produced by the kidneys that stimulates red blood cell production in the bone marrow
The process by which new red blood cells are produced in the bone marrow
The ability of a substance to cause birth defects or abnormalities in a developing fetus
The perception of ringing or buzzing noise in the ears without an external sound source
